column1: 8th grade students achieving math standards
Minnesota, 2006-2017
Number meeting or exceeding proficiency for 8th grade math (MCA-II)
Percent meeting or exceeding standards in 8th grade math (MCA-II)
Total students (for whom scores are reported) for 8th grade math (MCA-II)
Number meeting or exceeding proficiency for 8th grade math (MCA-III)
Percent meeting or exceeding standards in 8th grade math (MCA-III)
Total students (for whom scores are reported) for 8th grade math (MCA-III)
Notes:
CAUTION: Mathematics MCA-II and MCA-III test specifications are different.
MCA-II test specifications are aligned to the 2003 Minnesota Academic
Standards; MCA-III test specifications are aligned to the 2007 Minnesota
Academic Standards. Users are strongly cautioned against comparing data or
drawing conclusions about mathematics achievement between the two tests.
The Minnesota Comprehensive Assessment (MCA), the MCA-Modified, and the
Minnesota Test of Academic Skills (MTAS) are state tests that help
districts measure student progress toward Minnesota's Academic Standards,
the state's definition of what students should know in each grade. These
assessments also meet the requirements of the Elementary and Secondary
Education Act (ESEA), and mathematics and reading assessments are also used
in federal school accountability measurements.
Students take one test in mathematics each year in grades 3-8 and in grade
11. Most students take the MCA, but students who receive special education
services and meet eligibility requirements may take the MCA-Modified or the
MTAS.
Students in grades 3-8 took the mathematics MCA-II until the 2009-2010
academic year, and have taken the mathematics MCA-III since the 2010-2011
academic year. Students in grade 11 have taken the mathematics MCA-III
since the 2013-2014 academic year.
The percentage meeting or exceeding standards indicates the share of
students achieving the expectations of the state standards for their grade
level. MCA exams are administered during the spring, so the data year
represents the second year of an academic school year; for example, 2017
data represents the 2016-2017 school year. Data are for public school
districts only; excludes all private schools.
School districts are assigned to the counties and regions where their
district offices are located. In the cases where districts cross county
boundaries, users are encouraged to view the breakdowns “By district.”
County-level data is not available for 2006 and 2009. In these years, the
county totals are calculated by summing up the data for all districts in
the county for which data are available. Districts where data is suppressed
to protect privacy are omitted from both the numerator and the
denominator.
Sources:
Minnesota Department of Education.
http://w20.education.state.mn.us/MDEAnalytics/Data.jsp
Data downloaded from http://www.mncompass.org on 04/09/2018
